column2: ChristyLynn, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on 40 mg of Celexa 10 years for anxiety and panic attacks I developed as a teenager. I once tried to wean off of it with the help of my doctor when I was in college (I felt great and didn't think I needed it anymore) but the panic attacks returned so I've been consistently taking it and feel like a normal person! It originally took me about 2 weeks to fully adjust to the medication and help relieve my anxiety. Unlike what some people believe, I still have emotions! I cry, I get stressed, I feel joy, etc. I just feel like a normal person and that's all I could ask for. I did not gain weight either. The only side effect I have is occasionally I get "brain farts" which I like to call them when I have trouble remembering a fact or something! ha! (I've read this is a side effect of celexa) I can live with this because I feel like me and if you have had panic attacks you know how horrible they can be! My doctor says as long as I feel great I can take the drug as long as I want! :) Hope this helps anyone who is on the fence about celexa.

column2: sleepfan, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Been taking Celexa on and off for about 4 years now. Also taking during my pregnancy, my OB said it is safe for pregnant women. When I don't take Celexa, I become agoraphobic and cannot drive in the freeway or leave far from home. With Celexa I have no anxiet throughout the day like I used to. I do not know why I developed Panic Disorder, suspect I got it from my father. I made the mistake of weaning myself off Celexa last year, only to have my Panic and anxiety disorder come back. After I REstarted Celexa again in March, it took 2 and a half weeks to be able to come out of my home after being housebound for two weeks. When it starts to kick in, it takes about two to three weeks, and it didn't stop me from worrying about having a panic attack. I had to test the medication by forcing myself to drive alone around the neighborhood. After one week on it, I didn't get a racing heart, but could only drive 3 blocks. After two weeks on it I was  still hyperventilating a little bit when I drove 3 blocks. But after 2 and a half weeks on it, I was symptome free physically. It did not stop the mental thoughts of "what if I get a panic atttack". Those thoughts did not fade away until I drove around a farther and farther away from home a little everyday. Then after that, I didn't have worrisome thoughts after. Overall, I highly recommend it for Panic Disorder, Social Anxiety Disorder, and Agoraphobia. I am taking 20 mg. But will like to raise it to 30 mg if I find a job where I have to communt ten miles each day.

column2: heart604, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
column9: My wife has been on Celexa since 2004 and it helped with her depression till about 2008. She was started on 20 mgs then 40,then 50, then 60 and he wanted to take her to 80!  About 1 1/2 years ago I notice a change in her behavior.  My wife of 47 years was getting more distant and showed little or no affection.  Our relations are 0 now and we had always had a very affectionate and warm relationship, and that was gone.  The day it came to a head I put my arms around her in the kitchen one morning to give her a hug and she stood there like she was a robot with no feeling.  It hit me so hard for the rest of that day I though I would die of a broken heart.  This is when I started to to use Web MD to look into the meds that she was taking and found our what was going on because of the Celexa.  I talked to her Psychiatrist and he told me in so may words it wasn't any of my business and my wife was his patient.  "What the heck about our marriage"?  I trusted these doctors and I feel they have made a bigger mess of my wife then when she started her treatment for depression.  I am glad after we had talked the doctor has changed her to Lexapro with Wellbutrin and the fog seems to be lifting, but she has a long way to go to get back to her normal self.  I feel that before our spouses are put on these medications the family members need to be brought in, and helped to understand what they need to do to be the support structure for the depressed member.  If the member getting the help loses the love and support of the spouse it will make things much worse for the for the marriage an relationship. I would like to see the family member have several sections together and maybe work through the depression if possible before the SSRI medications are prescribed,  I feel that the patient becomes addicted to these medications.  I love my wife very much after all of these years and I wish I would have been included with the therapy that she was being prescribed and not pushed on the side.

column2: Veeco, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is only day 2 of taking this drug (20mg) but I wanted to share with the community how it is making me feel so that it may help others make an informed decision. I am a male, 34, weigh 195lbs, with a very high metabolism. Diagnosed with GAD back in 2001 after a panic attack / excessive sweating (Hyperhidrosis) / general feeling that something bad was gonna happen (post 9/11?). Anxiety / Depression are in my family history. I have been taking .25mg of xanax as needed during this period of time with good results. After getting a new (and very stressful) job in May, it didn't take long for my anxiety disorder to intensify and lead to a higher level of depression, with the first ever suicidal thoughts coming over the holiday break. The stress of the ridiculous unrealistic expectations of my employer combined with the responsibility that if I mess up our soldiers lives are at risk was too much to bare. I began double dosing my xanax just to get thru the work day and drinking heavily after work almost daily. Mood swings were out of control and I would just cry. Decided to go on LOA and spoke with my PCP about my issues. She prescribed the Celexa and asked me to go back to taking the .25 xanax as needed instead of daily. I also began seeing a counselor who agreed with the PCP about trying Celexa. After my first dose yesterday I almost instantly felt some side effects. Nausea, stomach pains (mild), light-headed, excessive yawning, dry and bad taste in my mouth, shortness of breathe, and sweating of hands / feet / underarms is on a new level. Also feel lethargic and like a zombie. I will post again in a few weeks once I have more experience with the drug.

column9: I started taking Celexa about a week ago and so far I am just "okay". I've noticed that I do not feel as anxious as I used to; I can now eat breakfast and lunch which I was unable to do before because of my anxiety. I can say that it is a major improve over what I was experiencing before.  The first day I had really bad nausea(maybe or maybe not because I was anxious about taking the SSRI) and now I'm just exhausted. I yawn constantly and feel drowsy in my classes; I'm also sleeping more than I used to. But I'd rather be drowsy than hyped  up and nauseated on nervous energy. So overall - I'm hopeful about the drug. I also have had loss of libido. No depression. No suicidal thoughts.

column2: Stephanie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was taking Lexapro for a few years before switching to Celexa due to insurance.  I had some unforseen circumstances that had me getting really depressed, unmotivated, and lack of energy, so my Dr. had increased my Lexapro from 10 mg to 20 mg.  When insurance became an issue I switched to Celexa 40mg.  When I had increased my Lexapro dose I found I was almost emotionless, and I found myself being forgetfull.  I also was experiencing a decrease interest in sex.  When I switched to Celexa those side effects disappeared.  I found myself being more motivated, feeling happy emotions again, and my sexual desire went almost back to normal.  I did notice when switching to Celexa that I experienced frequent yawning, but this went away after a month or so.  I have noticed that I have gained a bit of weight since I switched to Celexa, but I have not been on it long enough or gained enough weight to know for sure if Celexa is the reason.  I haven't had any change in my diet or activity level (I eat very healthy and i'm pretty active).  Overall I am very satisfied with this drug.  Although I was doing great using the lower dose of Lexapro, the Celexa worked much better for me when increasing the dose.  As with all anti depressants you have to wait 6-8 weeks to see the full effects and really know if it's working for you.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
hellokitty, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
Rick, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After the death of my teensge son in 2003, i began using Lexapro due to a lot of anxiety and mild depression.  I fought through the earlier side-effects (jitteriness, clenching my jaws, some suicidal thoughts but not intense) and then began feeling better (more relaxed and not dwelling on particular negative thoughts).  After a couple of years, I reduced dose from 10mg to 5mg.  After 3-4 years at 5mg, I then weaned myself off over a six month period.  Within a few weeks, I felt very irritable and a little out of control, emotionally.  My wife sent me back to the doctor and was prescribed Celexa 20mg.  It helped immediately.  I've taken it for the past year without any noticable side-effects.  I'm 58 and very active.  I do go to the local YMCA about 5 days a week and run about 15 miles a week on the treadmill as well as using other exercise equipment.  I am a big advocate of using exercise to treat anxiety and depression.  Celexa and exercise has been a good combination for me.  I had always been fit and trim before my son died.  I gained about 15 pounds and had trouble being focused to lose weight.  During the past year I have lost 15 pounds and feel much, much better.  I won't give Celexa all of the credit, but I think it has helped.  I would recommend it for mild/moderate depression and anxiety.

column2: 65-74 Female  (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
TheThing, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Celexa and Ativan for panic disorder and depression about 4 months ago.  The Celexa has been helpful for my depression, but has not done much for my anxiety/panic attacks.  Combined with the Ativan it reduces the panic attacks, but I still have a lot of anxiety just from anticipation of certain situations.  I wanted to write a review to address the issue of weight gain.  Before taking Celexa I was very active, mostly with weight lifting and mountain biking.  I was in pretty good shape and had 13% bf at 195lbs. I don't think Celexa causes weight gain.  What happens, at least in my case, is that I got so tired that I lost the motivation to  go to the gym and after about 3 weeks I no longer went to the Gym at all.  So for 3 months I have not exercised at all and have gained some fat weight.  My weight on the scale is about the same, but my body composition is different.  I think after awhile your body gets used to the chemical and you are not so tired.  I have just recently started back at the gym, so maybe I can get back in shape while on Celexa. Another topic I wanted to hit on is anxiety.  Celexa does not do much for anxiety. I think that it can help you  break through some depression which might help you to get motivated to do something about your anxiety.  This is how it has worked in my cause.  Unfortunately I think anxiety is something  I will have to struggle with forever.

column2: 55-64 Female  (Patient)
column9: I have been on Celexa for four years and it has saved my life.  I had horrible anxiety.  My mind worried constantly every day and I could not break the cycle.  Therapy helped control the worrying but it took me hours of soothing myself before my anxiety would start to decrease.  I was on blood pressure medication as well since my anxiety was so high.  This went on for 3 years.  Since taking Celexa, my mind no longer worries endlessly and my blood pressure is back to normal.  I have regained my life and it is a miracle.  I would highly recommend this drug.  Before I had no quality of life and now I feel very happy.  I was up to 40 mg. at one time early on but found that if I took a nap, I was down for hours.  I was sleeping very deeply.  Now that I have cut back to 20 mg. my sleep is better.  I do have some of the strange dreams, which is a side effect, but that is minimal compared to the tremendous relief that has come about in my life.

column2: brittanyjade, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Celexa about a month ago. I was dealing with the stress of getting out of an abusive relationship, school, and work. I'm 18 years old, and I live by myself. Have hardly any friends because of the abusive ex boyfriend. I was going through A LOT. I had panic attacks. suicidal thoughts. the whole nine yards. I finally went to the doctor, and he diagnosed me with severe depression and anxiety. so he put me on 20mg of Celexa, and it has worked wonders. I have moments where i'm down, but they're not as severe as before. i don't cry as often. and i don't think about ways i could kill myself and make it look like an accident. i'm such a happy person now. it's great. everyone enjoys being around me. and i can actually carry on a converstion with someone. the side affects were crazy at first. i was so sick to my stomach, and i yawned so much. but those are long gone, and i would highly reccomend anyone to take this anti-depressant. (:

column2: Deafguy, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Took Celexa for over three years.  Side effects suck, caused more anxiety than it cured. Made me sleepy during the day and no sexual desire. Gave me tremors and weird brain freezes where I couldn't think straight.  I slowly filed the dosage down over several weeks and have finally stopped using it. I didn't experience withdrawal symptoms too bad.  New research found it caused heart problems at > 40 mg.  Never take it again.  I don't care what the doctors tell you.  These pills are poison, they may relieve your sypmtoms for a while, but when you try to get off them it's like a psychotic nightmare.  The doctors have no idea how horrible the withdrawal is from these medications.  Some people never return to normal after stopping.  Before taking any depression meds have your doctor give you several suggested ones to review before you select one. Try to find one that doesn't cause horrible withdrawal symptoms or have side effects worse than being depressed.  Good luck.

column9: About a month ago I went to my clinic for extreme anxiety. I talked to the psychiatrist and he prescribed Celexa. I was hypervigiliant, thought about suicide all the time, I ate constantly, and I was so anxious about everyday life I couldn't concentrate.Started off with the half a pill for seven days. I woke up with gloom and doom thoughts, rapid heartbeat the first two days on the half pill. On the third day I woke up, calm, with a normal heartbeat. I finally felt like myself. Went on the full dose (40 mg) four days later, but I could tell it was too much. I felt dead inside, just like I did with the Paxil I took two years ago, so I went back to the 20 mg dose after two weeks. I feel a little anxiety, but nothing like it was before. I feel like I can handle life now. I do have to remind myself to drink a lot more water because dryness seems to be a minor side effect. My appetite has also decreased. I eat when I'm hungry, not when I'm worried.

column2: Mainelee51, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: In 2008 I was diagnosed with Borderline Personality Disorder and PTSD after I began experiencing severe panic, anxiety, social anxiety disorders, and having attempted suicide more than once. I was first placed on 5mg of Citalopram (twice a day)and 18 months later my dosage was increased to 10mg (d.i.d.) and I seriously doubt I would be alive today had it not been for Citalopram. I am now on a combination of drug therapies including Citalopram (10mg b.i.d), Buproprion XL (300 mg q.i.d.), Lorazepam (1mg q6h), and Trazedone (100mg at bedtime). I doubt I will ever return to what I consider a normal life, but I am at least able to leave my home now and go to the drug store and grocery store. I still have a great deal of trouble with social events, but that is also due to the fact that I have stage-4-COPD and am on oxygen 24-7 which has taken a huge psychological toll on me. This is not including the physical ravages that past HIV medications have had not only on my physical appearance, but my mental state as well. I was infected with HIV in July 1985, but not diagnosed until February 1986. I have suffered from severe wasting syndrome, lipidystrophy, and lipoatrophy due to the toxicity of the various medications I was on from 1986-2006.

column2: 65-74 Female  (Patient)
column9: I was experiencing severe depression and my provider prescribed Celexa, with a beginning low dose. For several months, I had been limiting my food intake to lose weight and my protein levels were probably low.  I did not share this with my provider as I did not know that it could impact the effects of Celexa.  I took the medicine for 1.5 months, starting with a low dosage. I developed a severe skin rash that has been diagnosed as an rare skin disorder.  The rash is still present on my back, arms, legs, and in my hairline.  The itching is unbearable and predisone did not relieve it.  In reading these posts, I read one from the woman whose sister committed suicide while on Celexa and that Celexa had become toxic because she had been dieting and her protein levels were low.  I believe that the Celexa became toxic in my system. Tell your doctor if you are dieting prior to taking this drug and be careful.  Celexa also made me like a zombie.

column2: Amylein17, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is a follow up review from July 2010. I took generic Celexa for 9-10 months. I gained about 10 pounds and was sleeping excessively. I would sleep 8 hours each night and still felt like I needed a nap every day. I went off this medicine to try ibuprpion to help me quit smoking. That was a failure-felt like a witch and it wasn't very effective at helping me stop smoking. After I went off ibupropion, I tried not taking any medicine, but rather supplements. I took 5HTP (for depression) and valerian root for anxiety for about a month. It helped a little, but not like AD medication. So I told my doctor I wanted something that made me feel like Celexa (happy, no worries, emotionally awesome), but that wouldn't make me hungry and sleepy all the time. She prescribed generic prozac which I've been taking for a little over a month. I really like it so far-normal appetite, sleeping ok, and feel good emotionally. I have noticed a bit of vaginal tenderness/inflammation, but I presume that is happening due to decreased frequency of sex. Other reviewers of generic prozac have said they've noticed it as well. As with Celexa, my libido has decreased, but that has actually helped since my partner has a weaker than libido than I did before depression hit. Overall, I'm very satisfied with generic prozac. Will follow up in the future if anything changes.

oceandoll, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I have been on and off this medication for 4 years and at first was very effective.  I no longer experienced mood swings and overall seemed happy about everything.  I have been off of it for 3 months due to the fact that it wasn't working anymore.  I started to become more irritable and mood swings were present once again and have since spoke to my doctor about switching me to something else....she prescribed Pristiq.  I am only one week in and feeling better so far.  As far as Celexa, if and when you want to ween yourself off, doing so cold turkey will not work.  You will have to cut the pill in half or in 4's and get off that way.  I tried cold turkey and experience the worst side effects ever.  Vivid nightmares, electrical brain shocks, severe headaches.  Its not worth it.  Go slowly when getting off this med and know that it may take you up to 8 months as it took 6 months to get off in my case.  Good luck!

THE GOOD THING ABOUT CELEXA WORKS VERY WELL FOR SHORT-TERM NO MORE ANXIETY,PANIC ATTACKS...... ETC AND ON JUST NORMAL  PERSON. I WAS ON CELEXA FOR 2.4 YEARS STARTED WITH 20MG FOR 3 MONTHS THEN INCREASED TO 40MG FOR  8 MONTHS THEN INCREASED TO 60MG FOR 5 MONTHS MY BRAIN AND BODY BECAME VERY DEPENDED ON IT AND CELEXA STOP WORKING MY MOOD AND SYMPTOMS WENT BACK WHERE IT WAS 2.4 YEARS AGO. THE SIDE EFFECTS ARE ANXIETY-VERY SUICIDAL-VERY DEPRESS-ANGER-SEX DRIVE O.K-MILD RASH-ITCHING-VERY LIGHT NOSE BLEED-ELECTORAL SHOCK-DRY MOUTH-SLEEPLESS-GRINDING TEETHS AT SLEEP-SWEATING-WEAKNESS-FLU SYMPTOMS-NERVOUS-LOST WEIGHT 5 LBS AND FATIGUED. column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After a tragic suicide, I began to experience horrible anxiety, OCD and depression. Citalopram (celexa) was first prescribed to me in 20mg, but later proved to be too much (caused me MORE anxiety than i began with) and I dropped down to 10mg/once a day. *Sometimes, going up in your dosage is not always the right answer!* This medicine has worked wonders. At first, the side effects outweighed the benefits but I stuck through it. I gained about 10-15 lbs. in 2 months. But I'm happy, and hopeful. Took about 4-6 weeks to fully see benefits. I've been on it over a year now and continue to take it, no side effects anymore. Be patient to allow the side effects to wear off AND allow the full potential of the medicine to show through :)          - about 6 months after being on celexa (citalopram) my doc also prescribed Bupropion (generic wellbutrin) 150mg/once a day. I feel amazing! And i've lost the weight I put on from celexa!

column2: Gary, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Depression and anxiety attacks gradually crept into my life. The last four years saw a random like up swing, first in anxiety attacks and then finally sudden and deep depression. I have been taking celexa for almost three weeks at the time of this writing. Day two I was on the treadmill watching tv and I caught myself laughing at the comedy show. My wife ran into the room and stood amazed it had been that long since she heard me laugh. My high school students even noticed that I was smiling and laughing in class. It is little things like this that show me how far I had slowly regressed over the years. I feel alive again. Social gatherings that used to be painful, due to fear of anxiety attacks, seem to have disappeared. It's like I keep waiting for the anxiety to take over, but it doesn't. So I am still adjusting to the new me. The first few days I had really bad headaches and dry mouth. Headaches are gone and I sip water, especially at night. I can't believe that little pill has changed my life in such a positive way. I thank God and my doctor every day. I don't know when the anxiety and resultant depression started. I had testicular cancer 30 years ago, maybe that was the trigger. All I know is that slowly over the last 30 years, I was ever so slowly changing for the worse. So I am learning to love life again. Take heart all of you who know what I am saying. I feel young again.

The only other side effect I've had would be waking up in the middle of the night starving 1-3 times a week. I am currently in the process of switching to Prozac due to the excessive weight gain. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend this drug for anxiety issues. Its a great drug to try first. My weight gain is just a freak thing so don't be scared off. Trying it won't hurt! It did ease my physical anxiety symptoms immediately, but the racing thoughts didn't cease for at least a month into it. Good luck!

I even went to the emergency room because I thought I was going to die. I did not know what was wrong with me. It wasn't until my doctor told me what anxiety/depression can do to a person. I was against taking medication so I went a year without taking any form of medication, and what a mistake that was. Worst year of my life. I finally gave into my doctors recommendation and began taking Celexa and after about 5 months, I was feeling great again. My self confidence was back, my anxiety and depression symptoms had subsided it was wonderful. I realize today that some of us just have a chemical imbalance that needs to be treated with medication. Please give Celexa a chance it worked wonders for me. I will continue to take it.

column2: bumpinthenight, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 16 year old with social phobia and depression. I've had both ever since i remember, but my social phobia got significantly worse in 9th grade. I woke up in the morning dreading the day and thinking of any excuse to give my mother not to go. During the summer i didn't leave the house or shower for 2 months and rarely ate. I read 24/7 to get my mind off depression. My mother got worried and sent me to therpy. I was diagnosed with social phobia, but kept my depression to myself. I was put on prozac for about a month. I got really hyper and woke up energized. I could not stop talking. My anxiety got better, but unfortunately my depression did not. I started self injuring and had trouble falling asleep. I've had suicidal thoughts before but i've always had a little bit of hope. One night i coudn't sleep and felt totally hopeless and started planing how i would kill myself. So i told my mom my medicine had kept me up and i needed to change it. I told my theripist that i coudn't sleep and that i felt hopeless the whole time on prozac. He told me that was impossible. Yeah, alright. They put me on celexa first on 10mg but that did nothing. They put me on 20mg and i take it at night because it makes me tired. I had no side effects. It has helped with the general feelings of anxiety. Like when i wake up in the morning i don't have to make excuses not to go to school. I can go to parties with my parents and can handle being around adults better, but once someone talks to me the anxiety lasts all day. So i'm feeling kinda bittersweet about it. I might have to up my dose or something. It hasn't helped my depression at all. I hope someone finds this helpful, haha.

column2: kosamui23, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: 5mg celexa provided a tremendous improvement in my anxiety symptoms after several weeks of use.  I was consumed by anxiety which has been a lifelong problem since I was a child, resulting more and more in physical symptoms as I get older (frequent "adrenaline rushes", indigestion/IBS, chest tightness, prolonged pounding heartbeat and, recently, mild panic attacks that were interfering with my sleep and ability to function). 5 years ago at age 22, I first started taking Celexa 10mg. At the onset of my treatment I was very stressed out and nervous. I got a number of moderate side effects: heart palipatations, heart "skipping a beat", and one episode of very rapid heartbeat that was scary because I was not prepared for it. I stayed on the medication and within a week the side effects went away. 10mg was eventually reduced to 5mg because I found that 10mg resulted in too much of a relaxing effect (carelessness, lack of motivation). 5mg improved this considerably.  I stayed on 5mg for over a year and eventually went off the medication altogether at the direction of the doctor because my symptoms were under control. 2 yrs later, anxiety symptoms returned amidst new life changes and stress.  I went back on 5mg celexa to mitigate the physical symptoms I was having.  My latest bouts of anxiety prior to taking Celexa were very distracting and were affecting my body. I saw a cardiologist because my heart was constantly pounding, blood rushing in my head when I tried to sleep. They ruled out any physical cause so I started taking 5mg Celexa again. Have been very pleased with the results. This medication almost entirely eliminates the abnormal anxiety that I have experienced recently and at other points in my life. I am on a very low dose, which is enough for me to respond to, and I do not experience any negative side effects.  The medication does prolongue sexual performance even at this low dose (consider that to be a positive side effect not a negative one).

column2: Omega1697, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking Celexa 20mg (generic citalopram, its a lot cheaper) The first week of August this year. I was diagnosed with Major Depression and Generalized Anxiety Disorder. I take it once a day at night (with food to diminish any possible gastrointestinal side effects). I am feeling 100% better than I did just a few months ago. I could not be more satisfied with the outcome. Before, I could not sleep or focus on anything. I was nauseas and exhausted all of the time and I even felt so dizzy I couldnt drive or go to class. I am now falling asleep without the help of sleep-aids. I have energy again; I no longer sleep 8 hours and wake up feeling more exhausted than I did the night before. FOR ME this was the correct medication. NO MEDICATION IS CORRECT FOR EVERYONE. There are several negative reviews from individuals; take them with a grain of salt. Yes, the first week can be miserable on a new anti-depressant (you have serotonin receptors all over your body, including your brain, blood vessels and stomach. While your body is adjusting to the new levels of serotonin, you will probably feel nauseas and have a headache). You have to be patient though! After a week I could feel a difference, and after a month I felt great. I feel like my old self again. The only downside I can find with the drug is that I cannot drink AT ALL on this drug. As with most SSRIs, alcohol renders the medication ineffective because Alcohol occupies the same receptors in your body. Massive panic attacks came for an entire week after drinking moderately. I would happily give up alcohol for the rest of my life to NEVER feel the depression and anxiety ever again though. There are also sexual side effects, but for me they have been positive. I can now maintain an erection and have a healthy sex life. I also have no problem with having orgasms. Do not rule out any drug because of the reviews on here. Eventually, you WILL find the right drug for you :). HANG IN THERE!!

column2: Jenn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

It took me about 6 mos to decide then I couldn't take feeling the way I did anymore.  I can tell you that I am on 10 mg for about 9 mos and after the initial couple of weeks I don't have any side affects. I also feel like a normal person for the first time in a long time! Now I tell close friends about it who may have similar symptoms and I rave about it.  I used to cry for no reason and now I don't anymore but I still feel like myself. column2: Snuggles, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Gen. Celexa for about a year now. My first week I felt wasted drunk the entire time but it tapered of and since then I have felt great so long as I remember to take it. When I forget to take it the withdrawal symptoms are cripling; headaches, out of body feelings, tremmors, etc. The constant negatives I have experienced are constant fatigue, loss of appetite (lost 25 lbs in the last few months) sometimes I get irritated for no reason but not frequently. I really have not had a loss of sex drive which is unfortunate mine could stand to go down a bit. Overall Im very happy with it I feel more level and on the ball. I did try to take myself off of it at one point but was unsuccessful the side effects from quitting are unbarable severe nausea and dizziness crippling depression suicidal thoughts I could not summon the will to do anything I was physically and mentally destroyed they were enough to make me want to take it for the rest of my life. Do your research do not start this lightly it is a commitment and can really hurt you if you arent careful. The risks are worth the rewards if it works for you though.

column9: I have tried a few anti-depressants (moderate depression) on and off for 20 years.  I always gave up on them, finding no results whatsoever. At first upon taking, I thought I was "going crazy"..for two days after starting I had the worst panic attacks ever and insane insomnia .  But now all of sudden, I am sleeping through the night(albeit bizarre dreams), I do not feel the dread or doom, have lost 5 pounds, and feel optimistic about life.  I urge everyone to give it a chance.  It may not be for all, but it is already helping my life...will write again at 20 days out to report.  P.S. I have less desire to smoke, which is a GREAT plus!!

column2: mommacat4, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started taking after being on Paxil 20mg for 1 1/2 months because the Paxil was not working.  The Celexa has brought me out of that paxil "fog" and not be tired all the time. The side effects were Very minimal because I had already went through them when starting the Paxil (and they weren't that bad anyways--)It has helped more then the Paxil did and has less side effects. I had dry mouth but drank lots of water and chewed gum-it only lasted about 4 days. Yawned alot for about a week but then  it was gone. Cloudy (Paxil) head was gone within 2 days and now I can really put things into perspective compared to before. I feel stronger emotionally and more in control of situations. I feel human again.Have ringing in my ears still(which Doc says is unrelated--BUT I disagree--it is dealable though if this pill is going to work then I can deal !! Have been on it for 3wks. I haven't been as depressed and so far my anxiety hasn't bothered me. If anything it has made me realize I needed the help and am glad and proud of myself for getting it and the will-power to get more help if needed. Will continue to update.It is important to know that most people do NOT have bad side effects to antidepressants..They can however talk themselves into it by being so nervous of a side effect..I tried to look at it differently..I kept looking for all the good the pill is doing and making me feel rather then any thing possibly bad,which like I said was very minimum and dealable. Give it 1 1/2 wks. and see if it works for you (after all if you have the FLU you are sick that long also so take the pill and wait a week to decided.

column2: ladypixie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this med for 3-4 years now with doses right up to 60mg/day. I didn't find that 60mg was any more effective than 40mg so have stuck at 40 for most of the time I have been taking it. I was prescribed this drug after taking many other anti-depressants which failed to help my mood, and as anxiety and panic were becoming more prominent in my depression we decided to try Celexa (citalopram). It has helped but only very slightly if I'm honest. I think for people who have mild-moderate depression it would probably be much more effective.As it turned out I was diagnosed with Bipolar early 2009 and this is probably the reason why it hasn't been so effective for me, but I can confidently say that I have had no bad side effects with Celexa, and have found it one of the easiest SSRI's to tolerate in terms of side effects. Even though I have said I haven't noticed a massive difference from it, I have noticed that when I have tried to withdraw from it than my anxiety has become pretty bad again so maybe it has helped slightly more than I give it credit for! Regardless, I plan to continue taking it for the foreseeable future.

column2: fullspectrum, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: i was first diagnosed '96 with schizo-affective. '99 major dep. Then '06 with bipolar depression. have tried numerous anti-depressants. Celexa 40mg seems to be the most tolerable by my metabolism. very low side effects. the nausea subsided after about 5 or 6 days. before taking my once a day dose in the morning i make sure to eat something to counteract the chance of nausea. my metabolic type is similar to my mother's whom is also on anti-depressants. we were both on zoloft 50mg for about 4 years. and both of us can not tolerate wellbutrin, paxil and especially prozac as they make us very jittery. i was initially started at 20mg once per day taken in the morning. however, i started with 10mg (half dosage) for for one week and upon second week added the other half to achieve full dosage. i am a survivor of two serious suicide attempts and the most important thing i can tell u besides seeking help (which is all around if u just look and ask) is to never, never give up on ur worth as a human being. best wishes and regards.

column2: beth, 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: This medication has been the only drug that has ever even touched me for the better. I used to think Paxil worked because I didnt know how much better it could be with celexa but almost immediately I felt like a new and improved girl. I never had a major depressive episode just an underlying dysthymia(low level depression)since high school. I always thought that I was just unhappy and that was that. About 6 years ago I started taking celexa after lexapro made me have zero improvement. The rest is history. The most wonderful drug in the world. Did gain about 10 pounds but that was the beginning and I would rather be 10 pounds heavier and happier then 10 pounds thinner and miserable. Now Im the thinnest I've ever been. I came to the conclusion that when you start taking the celexa you relax and arent as crazy about being a half a pound more. I always thought the other drugs I took(paxil, prozac, zoloft, wellbutrin, lexapro, buspar were working because I used to talk myself into the fact that I felt better when I felt no change. Celexa changed my life and showed me that its ok to try different drug and treatment modalities until something works because this is your life. You are worth it. Being happy is something we all(or at least I)was willing to give-up because I thought something was wrong with me because I never had much of an effect from anything. Take care people and take the time to find something that will help you!

column2: Piece of Work, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: 3 yrs ago in the midst of an event-induced depression & anxiety, 1st tried Zoloft; no help. Then citalopram (generic) at 20mg.  Almost immediate relief (but event soon concluded, too).  That said, the spiraling, out-of-control despair, dread & nausea stopped.  With citalopram, it felt like I was blocked from obsessing about the recent unendurable concerns (I'll get cancer like my mother, the world is full of incomprehensible suffering, even if things are good for a time they won't last, there's no joy...)-- either I couldn't focus on them anymore or I was on a track where I could not derail into despair.  At the same time, sexual interest declined and even when aroused, I couldn't climax.    BTW, husband has urged me NOT to go off drug.  He said he'd rather give up sex than have to go through my being depressed again!  Dr suggested reducing amount to 5 mg/day.  Sex now is usually better but still infrequent.  Realize menopause could be responsible, too, not to mention boring old routines of a 25 year marriage!  Weight gain-- a little.  Could be menopause, too.   Then again, if the effect of citalopram is to prevent focus on the negative, it stands to reason that it would prevent focus on the positive (sex, getting things accomplished).  There are always trade-offs.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: VT mama, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After a year and a half I finally went off the citalopram.  I really feel it made me want to drink alcohol and avoid my children.  It helped calm me and not snap at my kids but at the same time I could only deal with them in small spurts.  I would retreat outside to have a drink(alcohol) and a smoke and then come in feeling more able to deal.  I went from a drink during the weekend to everyday.  I'am so glad to be off it although I did it by going cold-turkey and it's made me feel a little lightheaded and I was a bit weepy at first.  I used Prozac 20 years ago for 2 years and that worked fine.  This citalopram makes me feel like I lost about a year of my life.  I did'nt feel present in my life as a wife and mother of 3.  It's been 10 days without it and my urge to drink and smoke cigarettes are gone.  Does anyone have any similiar experience?  I'm just really puzzled and without health insurance a sit down with a doctor is not a possibility.  Hope this helps.

column2: snowkitty, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this med for 4 mths now & am very happy w/the overall effect it has had on my mood. In the 1st 2 wks i experienced nausea (i take it at night before bedtime) and in the morning dizziness upon arising. Both were gone after about two weeks. I also experienced loss of appetite which was gone after a month. Never had any feeling of being in a "fog" but it has made me "not care", so to speak, about things that were bothering me before. I no longer have a crying "breakdown" once a month & my mood swings are gone. My family reports that i seem much happier and less stressed. They like the fact that i no longer yell & am not sad or angry alot. I just like the fact that for the 1st time in years i feel like "me" again. I'd recommend the drug & i'd recommend taking it at night if you are worried about side effects. I didn't experience any sleep issues but am on Ambien b/c of difficulty falling asleep & maintaining it anyway.

column2: Eva75, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started on 20mgs and felt better but not as good as i waned to feel, so my DR had me begin on 40mgs and i feel great! I did not experience any weight gain,in fact i am losing weight because i actually care enough about myself now to better my life. I had very few side effects and none that were bad. I knew that i had a problem with depression before i was never diagnosed and didn't want to rely on a drug to make me feel better but i had no other choice and i am glad i did. This drug has been an awesome addition to my life and well being! My sister in law is taking celexa as well at the same dosage as i am and had the same side effects and hers has stopped as well and is back to her normal self too. Stick with it the side effects can be annoying but once you get through them you feel alive again! Even if the effects were still present in me i would continue to take this medication. It really works!

I Had a better self motivation to get out of the bed every morning & much easier time getting along with everyone, especially my co-workers since I work in a stressful environment, the ER. But once I started taking celexa, I had no real side effects & I actually started to be able to live my life without the high stress levels, & my OCD accompanied with anxiety has been at an all-time low. I can say I am very satisfied :)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started celexa about 6-7 months ago.  the first few weeks were hard because the drowsiness i experianced was unreal. i would sleep all day after getting out of work at 2pm, and wake up to eat then go back to bed until the next morning. After a few weeks it got better and now i dont experiance the side effects anymore.  it has really helped my mood swings, and has allowed me to let the 'little' things go. Tho, at first that was hard for me because i wouldnt get upset over the things i used to get upset about and that would frusterate me. But eventually i learned that i was alright.

column2: Sarah2626, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was previously on Paxil but it made me feel depressed and emotionless.  I have only been on Celexa for three weeks and I can already feel the difference. Although, the first day I started it I took the 20mg dose as instructed by my doctor and it gave me a SEVERE panic attack.  The dose was then cut in half and slowly tapered up.  Have not had a problem since.

column2: cnl, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I take one in am/pm. It seems to be effective since depression has subsided somewhat.

column2: From IL to CA, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I feared that my anger and rage was going to get me in trouble. It certainly made my relationship with my wife, two young children, and my mother less than enjoyable, to put it mildly. I enjoy music again, and laugh a lot more. Gaining and maintaining a healthy looking weight has always been tough for me. I look better a little heavier and Celexa has increased my appetite and allowed me to gain 15 much needed pounds (I'm 170# now). I don't get NEARLY as upset at life's challenges. I started with 20 mg for about 3 months, but increased to 40mg and feel a lot better. I came off the meds for about 6 months and the old angry me came back. Oh well...whatever it takes for improve the LIFE experience. The only significant side effect I have is the ability to achieve orgasm. Erection is no prob but the O seems next to impossible. I tried wellbutrin for a few weeks to help with the O's but seemed to experience more aggression, so I quit that. Aside from that...this stuff is heaven sent.

column2: Honey44, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: PLEASE TALK TO YOUR DOCTOR BEFORE STARTING OR STOPPING THIS MEDICATION!! IT IS A GOOD MEDICATION BUT MAY NOT BE RIGHT FOR YOU. IF YOU WERE SATISFIED AND IT STOPPED WORKING,THEN YOU PROBABLY NEED A DOSE ADJUSTMENT. EVERYONE RESPONDS TO DIFFERENTLY TO DIFFERENT DOSES. SSRIs  ARE VERY EFFECTIVE AND ALL OF THEM DIFFER SLIGHTLY YET JUST ENOUGH TO CAUSE DIFFERENT SIDE EFFECTS IN DIFFERENT PEOPLE. PLEASE DO NOT LOSE HOPE. IT IS POSSIBLE TO FEEL GOOD AGAIN!!! AGAIN,I CAN NOT STRESS ENOUGH DO NOT START OR STOP THIS WITHOUT TAKING TO YOUR DOCTOR. REMEMBER TO TELL HIM EVERYTHING YOU TAKE. EVEN HERBAL REMEDIES CAN INTERACT UNPLEASANTLY AND DANGEROUSLY!!! ALSO READ UP ON EVERYTHING THAT YOU TAKE AND KEEP A LOG OF DAILY PROGRESS AND PITFALLS. TAKE IT TO YOUR APPOINTMENT WITH YOUR DOCTOR. YOU SHOULD ALSO INCLUDE ANY QUESTIONS THAT YOU MAY HAVE. DO NOT LET YOUR DOCTOR RUSH YOU OUT OF THE OFFICE. DO NOT LEAVE UNTIL YOU ARE SATISFIED WITH HIS ANSWERS AND THE WAY YOU ARE FEELING!!!!! HANG IN THERE

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this drug for depression, anxiety and panic attacks. I was prescribed it in combination with Klonopin. I first started taking it in the morning and noticed that it caused blurry vision, constant yawning and overall exhaustion...I then began taking it at night which turned out to be ok. After 2 months I lost 20lbs and actually felt better...Major side effect would be loss of libido...my sex drive that was already low because of depression and anxiety became non existent because of celexa. I could not "get in the mood", reach an orgasm or even think of sex. It definitely helps with depression and anxiety but you have to sacrifice your sex drive.

Celexa did work relatively well for my depression though.  I only had a couple of instances on it where the depression became debilitating.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: tried about a dozen drugs of this kind they all made my symptoms worse or did nothing at all. been on celexa off and on for years b\c it gives me my energy back which got me back in the gym which got me out of the house... negative thoughts subsided also on this med. still completely numb to all emotions like im not even alive which sucks. currently off this med for a few days and im experiencing shocks and low energy, trying something different. i would try this med before other ones but everyone is different

column2: Rdee8ch, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been cursed with panic attacks ever since I started menopause (about 4 yrs ago). The panic attacks were always a pre-cursor to hot flashes. I was having the panic attacks/hot flashes every 30 minutes to an hour. The panic attacks were severe enough to make me feel like I was going to die on the spot even though my mind knew different. I started at 20 mg., but that was only enough to take the edge off. I went from, "I'm doomed!" to "Oh,no!" My physician increased the dosage to 40 mg and my panic attacks are completely gone! The only side effect has been periodic hypnopomic hallucinations, which do not bother me. Celexa has been a god-send!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I just called inquiring about Wellbutrin (b/c I'm also trying to quit smoking) and he prescribed 10mg of wellbutrin with 20mg of celexa.  Is anyone on both of these?  Will this make my sex drive come back?

column2: Grace, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It definitely decreased my anxiety, which often leads to depression for me, but I stopped caring re my friends & clients (I'm a social worker!) & it made my ADD 10 times worse, so bad that I couldn't stay organized & on top of things at work. I've tried Paxil- made me happy, sleepy, & I gained 40 lbs in 4 months, Wellbutrin made me very grouchy, Vyvanse didn't let me sleep, & so now I just take Omega 3's, stay away from my allergens, & have lots of support from friends & God, & ask my friends to keep tabs on me, if I feel myself slipping into depression. I did learn, on the Celexa, that I don't have to worry as much as I do re situations.

column2: buggstar2000, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i started this after taking zoloft for 14 years, which i liked, it just stopped working.  i went up to 40 mg, and my anxiety seemed to disappear, but my mood was still poor.  i just felt "blah" all the time, so we went up to 50 mg, my mood was fantastic, but i started having more anxiety.  so we went back to 40 mg.  was at that dose for about 3 weeks when out of the blue i had a terrible panic attack.  the depersonalization/dissasociative feelings were unbearable.  even klonopin didn't help much.  this went on for at least a week of severe anxiety.  my dr. suggested that i was having a "paradoxical effect" from the meds.  meaning, it was doing exactly what it was supposed to prevent from happening.  so we tapered down to 30 mg.  i still felt dissasociated, so my dr. added 2mg abilify.  after a week i feel great.  over the next month we are going to slowly decrease the celexa and add a different antidepressant.  i just don't think it is the right one for me.  although i should add that i have friends on it that think it's wonderful.  everyone is different.

column2: customer 7, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Diagnosed with anxiety/depression.Decided the condition was better than taking Celexa. Developed 'lock jaw' & didn't care about anything.I went to a doctor about my insomnia & ended up at the campus psych clinic. The doc there put me on Celexa for a mood disorder. I still had insomnia, but Celexa seemed to help in other ways at first. Then came the apathy. I didn't care about anything. I stopped cleaning the house. I would forget to eat. I could have an orgasm, but didn't want to be bothered with sex. I had no concept of dates or deadlines. I almost failed out of grad school because I just didn't give a damn. Physically the worst thing were the jaw problems. Jaw clenching is a known side effect. Mine was so bad I ended up with TMJ. I was in constant pain and in the end I couldn't open my mouth over an inch wide. The pain lessened when I stopped Celexa. I still can't fully open my mouth, but it is slowly getting better. My 'whatever attitude' has also slowly improved. I still go to the same doctor & we are exploring other options. (Now if I could only get some sleep.)

column2: Elaine, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After trying generic versions of Zoloft and Wellbutrin, both of which gave me terrible side effects and no improvment in my depression, my sister (a nurse) suggested that I try Celexa. I am on a low dose (10 mg) and taking the "real deal," not generic, and am happy to report that my mood has stabilized and I have no side effects to speak of. The first week, I felt an almost uncontrollable desire to yawn, but this disappeared. I now feel "normal," and don't experience the mood swings I had before. The only caution I would give is that this medication MUST be taken daily at the same time. For several weeks, I missed taking it on a regular schedule and it was like I had to "reset" the drug in order for it to be effective. I now take my pill at 6:00 p.m. every day, and I feel fine.

column2: lindy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started on Celexa when depression began again after a recent divorce.  Took Lexapro about a year earlier, but Celexa a lot cheaper and insurance has high deductible.Side effects for the first month or so, pretty bad, very drowsy and craved caffeine.  Also felt suicidal about a week after starting; had not felt that before.  I stuck it out for about two months but ultimately, it did not work for me (20mg) and did not want to increase dosage due to side effects.Switched to Lexapro.  Felt better within a week and a half.  Much less anxiety, less depression, did not crave the caffeine to get my head out of the "fog".

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column9: I started taking celexa after a separation from my husband. After we seperated I was mildly depressed and I couldn't do much because I felt like I was in a fog. I suffered from some anxiety before and this seemed to not help with anxiety. column2: Tabatha, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I want you to know I am 31. I have three wonderful children and an amazing husband. I NEVER thought people should take medication that "took away" from how they felt. After all, our emotions are what make us human, they are what determines who we are through how we act. I didn't feel comfortable addmitting I needed help, however, someone recomended I see a doctor for something just to "take the edge off." I do have a "stress-related" job, and was always either snappy or over-reacting to situations. This medicine has been a God-send. I am still me, I feel every emotion, and at the same time, I think more clearly therefore I process it better and more accurately. I have never tried any medication like this before, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but I know it works for me. I am SO thankful to my doctor who has helped improve my intire life with this medication. I started taking it for 2 weeks just a half of pill a day, then we increased the dosage to a full pill after the two weeks. I have been on it for a little over a month and not only did I notice a huge change, but so has everyone else-with all the feedback being positive. I can only tell the women thinking about this, or maybe you haven't thought about it but someone has mentioned it to you, you won't believe how entirely you can still feel like yourself, while at the same time your life has changed so dramatically! For the woman who has SO much going on, work, husband, children, home, errands, this just places things into focus, and allows you to prioritize without anxiety. Good luck and God Bless.

column2: vier62, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have depression and a severe anxiety disorder. This medication works really well. I am on 40mg/d. I do experience some extreme sexual side effects from this drug (unable to ejaculate during sex). However, after doing some research I found a way around it and wanted to share. I take my 40mg dosage RIGHT before bed (I am sexually active with my girlfriend almost every night, so I take the medication after sex). While it is still "difficult" to achieve an orgasm, it is definitely not impossible. So, I just take the pill as late as possible, and then next night (about 18 hours after last dose) I have no problems. I hope this helps some of you.

column9: I have been taking Celexa, 40mg for over 8yrs. Before Celexa, I had severe depression and extreme anxiety that would merge into full blown panic attacks. Celexa has been a life saver for me. The effectiveness has, of course, worn off some because I have taking it for so long but I refuse to taper off of it. I do not want to experience the severe depression and anxiety that I once experienced a long time ago. I do feel depressed at the moment and have anxiety as well (It has lost it's effectiveness), so my doctor has also prescribed me Xanax as needed and another anti-depressant called Pristiq. I have only tried Prestiq for 5 days but already do not like the extremely negative side effects I am experiencing so I plan to stop taking this. The Xanax has helped tremendously with my anxiety. I wished I could just keep increasing the MG of Celexa, but my doctor told me I am maxed out. I may research this and see how many MG is the max for this medication. Oh yeah, this medication has not caused any major side effects for me, even in the beginning. My sex drive is still as great as ever.

column2: 36mom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Just re-started Celexa two weeks ago, first time I started on it I was taking 10mg a day and by the third day woke up at night in the middle of a full-blown panic attack out of nowhere.  Scared me so badly that I quit taking the prescription for two months.  Just re-started two weeks ago, was cutting the 20mg dose into half and then half again!, and this made my side-effects less acute.  It will take me longer to get to where I am hoping to be with my depression, but the panic attacks aren't worth it. Just increased to 10mg two days ago and last night had an awful time trying to fall asleep - racing thoughts, anxiety...the scariest part was the feeling of heat through my chest, arms and face (like an acute hot flash or sunburn?).  It actually woke me up several times, this hot-flash symptom, and I would be drenched in sweat....wondering if anyone else had this side-effect too? I am hopeing that it goes away soon!  Had such good luck with my last anti-depressant but it's $90 more a month than Celexa.  Am looking foward to "sunnier"-feeling days!

column2: AnxietyHypochondriac, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The drug has worked about 90% for me.  I'm a male in my 20s, a hypochondriac with severe anxiety disorder. Before taking this drug I would drive myself to the ER consistently thinking I was having a heart attack. Also a major fear of vomiting - the slightest stomach ache or indigestion would send me over the edge, and I would be petrified, literally shaking and trembling all over. I began seeing a psychiatrist and he put me on Celexa. I have seen a major, major difference .. although, like I said, I'd give it a 90% overall.. I still get nervous every once in a while about vomiting, and I'll have to leave work or drive myself to my 'comfort zone' (aka - home).  But this happens maybe once every three months - as oppose to every day!!  I can live normally again thanks to this drug. I strongly suggest taking it consistently at the SAME TIME every day.  This will increase its effectiveness. I felt a little dizzy when I first starting taking it but that went away in about a week. Lost my sex drive for a few weeks but then it came back in full force (thankfully!)  Give it a chance, don't let the side effects scare you - they are very mild. Doesn't bother my stomach at all.  If I skip a day or two, and resume, I'll feel the effects about 2 or 3 days later, strangely enough - i'll get a dizzy spell and a mild panic attack, or get depressed (feel like crying and be fearful of losing my parents - very weird).  I might be a kook with all of my anxieties, etc, but celexa allows me to hide them in front of others.  Great drug overall.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
caz, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Took cipramil (celexa brand name in the UK) for 2 years. A littel advertised side effect is "disinhibition". This caused me to make inappropriate comments and swear more etc...very weird! Unfortunately I lost my job over it before I discovered the cause and stopped taking the drug. When I stopped I found I was not depressed as badly as when I was on it and the anxiety had gone as well... this drug can be useful for short term use prior to counselling to deal with rather than bury the issues. I was also suffering from what is quaintly called "suicidal ideation" as I was convinced my family would be better off without me...really bad shit I think you'll agree! The reason for the disinhibition is that serotonin (which this drug increases in the brain to make you happier allegedly) is involved in your internal behaviour regulation. Really look out for this and the suicidal thoughts if you are taking this stuff esp long term.. at least it didn'tmake me sweat as much as Prozac did! good luck out there everyone.

column2: graciesmommy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Taking this med was the most horrible experience I ever had in my life. I began it in June 09 at 20mg because I was feeling sad and depressed out of the blue.. Have never had depression ever before. So De. says try this.. After a week, I felt nausea constantly-felt just ill. By week 2- I began having ear pain and headaches with the nausea/loss of appetite and most days felt unable to function- went to Dr to see if I had ear infection. No-- asked if it could be the meds. Again NO..By week 3- I had lost 24 pounds. I was then waking up with indigestion (mind you I was barely eating), constant nausea, fatigue, headaches, feeling of absolute illness- Went again to Dr. asking is this the meds doing this..Again NO.  Began getting freaked that I had some sort of disease that I was gonna die or something. Spent most days on couch, sick as hell. Finally week 4-more weight loss, feeling weird crazy thoughts, didnt trust myself, afraid- worried, felt like I was going insane and this with all the physical complaints. At end of Week 4, I said I quit this med.  I stopped it, went to see my hemotologist in tears begging him to see if I had cancer or something (brain tumor) because I have never had headaches like that ever. Told him about the Celexa  and that the day before I stopped taking them. He looked at me and said, IT IS the MEDS..Told me about the half life and give it time to get out of my system. Sure enough less than one week later, I felt 100 times better. He offered for me to try Wellbutrin but I was super afraid of the same thing happening. So I declined. However again about 2 weeks ago began feeling sad, depressed, weird gloomy out of the blue--all my blood hormone tests are normal- so called the  Hemotologist and saw him. began taking the Wellbutrin 150 about 4 days ago. The only thing I noticed I felt a little better, some energy,little irritable today..Will see how it goes. I am taking a half dose of .5mg of xanax as well, since I am nervous about the side effect

column2: Husband Wife Team, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: First of all I am the husband writing this for the wife. I am at work where we get internet access. My wife is 32 yo has been  diagnosed with PTSD, Bi-Polar, multi-personality disorder, anxiety, hypo thyroid disease, and depression. She is on abilify, clonazepam, levothyroxin. She was taking nerotriptilyn to help with sleep disorder but was removed from this and incresed the clonazepam at night. Been on Celexa for just over a week. At first she was tired all the time (was taking meds at night), then switched to mornings. That day she sleept all day long. Since that day, she has been not sleeping that long. She is smiling more and less talk about how she wants life to end or dwelling on the anxiety of life. She yawns a lot, but that is becoming less. The biggest problem she feels (and this is coming from her) is that she has a lack of sexual desire specifically decresed interest in sex and sexual ability. This fact is giving her a whole new and other reason for being depressed because sex is a part of our marriage that we both love. So has any married couples experienced this and have the sexual effects balanced out. Celexa works awesom for my wife, she has such a beautiful smile and laugh. I am falling in love with her all over again and it is great, just want the "other" effects to stop.

My family has noticed a big change in my personality. Im walking around happy and care free, and I enjoy waking up in the morning now. Major decrease in mood swings.

column2: joe, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
ChrisInMidwest, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was taking 20 mg of Lexapro before I switched to Celexa just over 3 wks ago. Lexapro had really helped me with my depression, but it was too expensive ($93/month) and it raised my sex drive very high. My sex drive is normally good, but on Lexapro it felt like I was 15 again-which sounds great, but it was very distracting to say the least. So I switched to Celexa. The only effect I liked was a normal to at times, a reduced libido, which felt alright.The other side effects were awful: headaches, very tired, irritable, and, worst of all, brain "fog' all day. My memory was just shot, because of the fog- far worse than anything I'd experienced before I'd taken any anti-depressants. I'm switching to a different med today once I hear back from my doctor's office, for hopes of a better outcome. Just a note to consult your dr when you switch medications, I made the mistake of not letting them know what I was going through and stopped cold turkey a few days ago. Now I'm even more irritable and my wife's not too happy with me, to say the least.

column2: LifeinProgress, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have been struggling with a severe case of depression for sometime, to the point where I have had sucidial thoughts and basically do not see the point in living...Finally accepted that I needed to seek professional help. Have tried Lexapro, Effexor and  Wellbutrin in the past for a very short time frame, all 3 gave me excrutiating headaches so I stopped taking them, not to mention severe anxiety and a general "weirded out" feeling.Have been taking Celexa 10mg for about 3 weeks now. I can tell you that I have not had headaches with the 10mg. My doctor wants to bump me up slowly to 20 or 40 mg, however, when I took 15mg, the headache was unbearable. My doctor suggested that I take it with two tylenols, which so far has been helpful. Haven't noticed a huge improvement in the depression, but I would say I am hopeful. Also, after reading some reviews, I started taking Celexa at night, so I am not groggy durig the day.As a side note, I am also someone who eats very healthy, works out daily and has a lot of family support. Thus, I hope that I will be able to be on Celexa long enough to dig out of what I like to call my depression, "the black hole". Trust me, if you are sensitive to medications in general, especially AntiDepressants, Celexa may work for you. I pray that someone reads this and find it helpful!!

I am on 10 mg a day-which isn't to much compared to some I see taking 20-30 mg a day.

column2: MommySusan1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from depression off and on for years and have taken Zoloft in the past.  This time it didn't seem to be working.  I also was hit with overwhelming anxiety because of my husband's job difficulties.  The doctor prescribed Celexa a couple of months ago.  After 3 weeks, I was ready to give up on this because it took longer to kick in than Zoloft. I also had terrible dry mouth and food just didn't taste good. But the Dr. bumped me up to 60 mg. and that really did the trick.  I only have dry mouth when I first wake up in the AM and food tastes good again.  My hubby said that on Zoloft I was more "flat emotioned" but on the Celexa, I have the normal ups and downs that everyone else has.  The only negative is that I am on the tired side, but not terribly bad.  It is a lot better than wanting to jump in front of a bus.  The best part is that a one month supply is only $4 at Walmart.  I urge everyone to give this a try and stick with it.  Good luck!

column2: rheakay01, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Before I was discharged from the Army, I was having pretty serious anxiety problems. It got to the point where I attempted suicide. I was having at least one big panic attack a day, couldn't handle crowds, all that junk. I couldn't take it anymore.I was hospitalized and put on Wellbutrin and Ativan. These made things a ton worse - I couldn't handle anything. I would break down if I someone looked at me funny, and I went days at a time without sleep. I ended up taking every pill I had, trying to make it stop. Needless to say, I was hospitalized again and taken off those meds pretty quick.Then I was given Celexa and oh my god, the panic and depression stopped. Not immediately, but it helped a lot. I could handle being inside again, with other people. Loud noises slowly stopped bothering me. Had it not been too late, I'd have fought my discharge (the paperwork had all gone through while I was in the hospital, and I left about a week later), because I was getting back to my normal self.I haven't experienced any weight gain, except from the normal being home and not exercising and eating junk food. At first, the pills made me manic and jittery - I felt like I'd drunk about six cups of strong coffee in one go for the entire day, and couldn't wind down without taking a sedative. I normalized after a couple weeks. Celexa has worked out awesomely for me.

column2: fragile1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have suffered with depression for many years. I had tried approx 6-7 other AD's, but to no avail. Some AD's did nothing to lessen the feelings of despair while some just seemed to worsen my condition. With this in mind, I resigned myself to the fact that I must continue to suffer the rest of my life,with this debilitating disease. Approx. 3 1/2 weeks ago, I relented and had asked my Dr. if I could try-(after 5 years of suffering w/o any meds), "Celexa". He agreed and put me on 20mg, 1x day. In the first week,I could feel a difference, a positive difference. 3 weeks later, Celexa has made a significant change with not only how I feel but also, my outlook on life.I can only conclude,that not only have I found "the one"-(Celexa), but with the help of your "readers reviews" and their experiences while using this drug, I have a renewed outlook on life, and freedom for the first time from horrible and debilitating disease! I often would say, "how much more can one endure"?! Well, no more. There is indeed, light at the end of the tunnel! Thank you readers and Good Luck to all!

zombiekristen, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took Celexa for about 6 months for extreme anxiety with depression and some suicidal thoughts. For 4 of those months I continued to self-medicate with marijuana on and off (hoping that the meds would be enough to help me quit, after two weeks, I no longer was able to hold out). I took 20mg for one week and then upped to 40mg ever since. In the beginning it made me dizzy and very tired. The drowsiness never subsided which is why I switched to taking it at night and have been ever since. When I had finally been able to stop smoking marijuana 4 months later, my anxiety had subsided and my depression blew up big time. I had many crying spells. I could not concentrate. I was very lethargic, as I had been the entire time, and the celexa was not helping that. What I needed was energy. I stopped taking the pill today with instructions from my doctor to switch immediately to 150mg of Effexor (which I'm pretty nervous about...) and the withdrawal effects I had were: vertigo, sweating, crying, severe depression. Celexa works for many people. It helped me out in the beginning, as it was the first time I had ever been on an antidepressant. But it never was consistent for me, and in the end my depression became unacceptable and the Celexa was doing nothing to help.

column2: RogerBaran, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I like this drug much better than Paxil. I have been on Celexa now for over 2 years and noticed improvement right away: Time didn't seem so collapsed -- I had "room to think" and a lot less "knee jerk" reactions to situations. My only concern is when I forget to take it -- the pressure in my head builds substantially and I feel very fatigued. However, with that warning sign I remember to take it immediately and I am ok again within an hour or so. If I don't take it for some reason (away from the house) then I seem to release the "Darth Vader" in me and I can become pretty unpleasant -- to anyone who happens to be around me at the time.I have remedied the above situation by setting a special ringtone to an alarm on my cellphone. It goes off every day at 7:00am. When I hear that special ring I know to check myself to see if I have taken my medications.Overall, I really like the way Celexa helps me manage life; way better than before. I also benefit from the return of my sex drive; which was almost totally gone while using paxil. All of the other drugs that I sampled seemed to have side effects that were unpleasant in one way or another. Not Celexa. It comes on mild from the start and smooths out the path quite nicely. By the third week or so I knew that I would stick with this drug.

column9: i started taking celexa 20 mg a 1  1/2 ago for extreme anxiety... i didnt sleep for 7 days straight because of the anxiety  ... i felt sick and depressed, heart racing and burning sensation in my arms and chest, vomiting , frequent urination, trembling and more symptoms.. the first 3 days i was on celexa i felt really wierd had anxiety bad the first night... but after that i started to feel better maybe having 3 anxiety spells a month that lasted for a short time..my dr recently upped my dose to 40 mg.. then he prescribed darvacet for my head aches a day after taking darvacet i was beck where i started with the anxiety that lasted for about 5 days but i was able to get some sleep though...i got off the darvacet quickly...but i was feeling really bad still after the anxiety went away... i felt tired and tense ... well it turns out your not suppost to take darvecet if you have an mental illness...well im going to take my self back down to 20 mg...  i took 30 mg yesterday and i felt better more awake and less tense..

column2: MsMom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have to say I went to my Doctor's today and she said that Celexa wasnt used to treat Bi-Polar! Here I am talking it for depression and it has no effect fo rthe Bi-Polar. She said that it only was making me worst so its not one to be used for BP!! I can tell you this because I havent felt any changes in me! I still feel terrible and unable to even be active!! column2: WorldTraveler, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Over the past few years I developed a fear of falling, the phobia increased so that I was holding on to walls within our home, unable to walk to my car, even with 2 canes, petrified in parking lots, even with a shopping card.  A psychiatrist put me on 5 mg. 2x a day, but the AM dose left me too groggy, the 5 mg. PM dose gave me the kind of sleep I haven't had since I was a teenager (deep, wonderful dream-filled sleep).  After 3 weeks, my anxiety began to lesson, after 6 weeks I was walking around not holding onto walls.  It has changed me life.  I'm calmer & the little stuff doesn't bother me any more.  The 10 lb. I gained after breaking my back, I can't seem to lose, so weight loss is harder, my strong libido is nearly non-existent, but I don't care, I'm not filled with dread & anxiety.  I'm not worried all the time.  Close friends have noticed these changes.  After 9 months, I have no plans to discontinue it.  Some of the night sweats others are feeling are probably peri-menopause.  It is hard on the stomach, I took it with 2 75 mg. Zantac for the first 2 weeks, then 1 Zantac for another 2 weeks, now my stomach is used to it.  I take it before bedtime.  So the nausea others have experienced might be alleviated by taking it with a Zantac because Celexa is an acidic drug.  5 mg. works so well for me, I'm incredulous as to the high doses that others are on.  It does take 6 weeks for the full effect, so be paient.
